frame.name: Experiencer_focus
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe an <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s emotions with respect to some <fen>Content</fen>. A <fen>Reason</fen> for the emotion may also be expressed. Although the <fen>Content</fen> may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.
<ex> <fex name="Experiencer">My</fex> <t>enjoyment</t> <fex name="Content">of the movie</fex> was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me. </ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Smithers</fex> <m>takes</m> <fex name="Degree">great</fex> <t>pleasure</t> <fex name="Content">in collecting matchboxes</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Sergio</fex> <m>derives</m> <fex name="Degree">great</fex> <t>pleasure</t> <fex name="Content">from smoking</fex>.</ex> <ex> Smoking <ment>gives</ment> <fex name="Experiencer">me</fex> <fex name="Degree">extreme</fex> <t>pleasure</t>.</ex> With certain verbs, the <fen>Circumstances</fen> can be expressed in a finite clausal or wh- complement which may optionally be preceded by a Null NP Object: <ex><fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> <t>hate</t> it <fex name="Circumstances">when you do that</fex>.</ex> Note: This is not how it is currently tagged. </def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon. The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Everyone</fex> <t>loves</t> <fex name="Content">compliments</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Everyone</fex> <t>loves</t> <fex name="Content">being complimented</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">His parents</fex> <t>despaired</t> <fex name="Content">of him</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">John</fex> <t>likes</t> <fex name="Content">that I cook him lunch</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> am <t>afraid</t> <fex name="Content">of spiders</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why an <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the particular emotion. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">People</fex> <t>love</t> <fex name="Content">giant pandas</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because they look like teddy bears</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
<ex> The <t>delight</t> <fex name="Expressor">on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment. </ex> <ex> The worshipper's <t>apprehensive</t> <fex name="Expressor">praise</fex> revealed his lacking devotion. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex>Very few physical science students stressed the <fex name="Parameter">intellectual</fex> <t>enjoyment</t> of the degree course. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Mr. Whiskers</fex> was <t>upset</t> <fex name="Topic">about his cat treats</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Experiencer">Tracy</fex> was in an <t>irritated</t> <fex name="State">mood</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. <ex> It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a <t>nervous</t> <fex name="Event">ceremony</fex>.</ex> Here we know that the ceremony was filled with nervous <fen>Experiencer</fen>s.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> FE encodes the circumstances or conditions under which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion. Unlike <fen>Content</fen> it does not give the specific content of the emotion, but the <fen>Content</fen> can often be inferred from the <fen>Circumstances</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
<ex><fex name="tim">Last year</fex>, Bob was still <t>interested</t> in the young Republicans.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: wanhopen.v
lexUnit.definition: geen hoop hebben op een goede afloop

lexUnit.name: spijt.n
lexUnit.definition: dat je hebt als je iets hebt gedaan waarvan je later vindt dat je het niet of anders had moeten doen

lexUnit.name: afschuw.n
lexUnit.definition: van afkeer of walging, dat hevig en onweerstaanbaar is
